body:
This PR address situation where adding topics matching a regex subscribed stream may not be detected by all followers in `StreamPartitionAssignor.subscribe` but are picked up when 
`ConsumerCoordinator.onJoinComplete` returns.

ping @mjsax @dguy @guozhangwang  for review

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.11/4455/
Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.11).

https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/4441/
Test FAILed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

> Similar issues for REQUEST_TIMEOUT_MS_CONFIG.

These are added as part of KIP-90 by @hjafarpour to be used for the admin client only for creating / deleting topics.
@ijuma : Thanks for the patch. LGTM
LGTM. Merged to trunk and 0.11.0.
@wushujames Merged to trunk and 0.11.0, thanks for your patience! I'm assuming you'll complete the rest pieces of #1202 ? :)
@becketqin can the corresponding ticket KAFKA-5078 be closed then? If you use the merge script it should do so automatically.

The test failure is `kafka.admin.DescribeConsumerGroupTest.testDescribeExistingGroupWithNoMembersWithNewConsumer` so I think this is unrelated to streams and this PR
retest this please

@junrao @ijuma I've updated the patch to reclaim the unchanged batch optimization. Please take another look. I've removed the check for max message size during recovery. I found that the batch iterator is already verifying that the batch size is within the limit of the file. If we find corrupted data at the end of the log during recovery, the iterator will return early and the bytes will be truncated.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/4447/
Test FAILed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

I think first-forward-then-store may not be perfect, as you can see the reversed case that, for example `builder.table("topic1", "store1").to("topic2")` a record "a -> 1"can be already sent to the downstream "topic2", but failed when trying to put into "store1". Then from "topic2" you could see:

```
a: 0 -> a: 1
a: 0 -> a: 1
```

twice.

Actually, it seems that currently `FATAL_ERROR` and `ABORTABLE_ERROR` states are not distinguished. I'm wondering if we can just use `FATAL_ERROR` state and in that state do not send abortTxn?

My naive implementation of cancellable was quite badly broken as it wasn't pointing at the latest PunctuationSchedule object, but always only the first one. About to commit something more involved but functional.

Hi @enothereska , thanks for asking me for an opinion on this but with my limited experience with this codebase, I feel I have little to contribute at this point.
One thing that was bugging me about the MinTimestampTracker was that it's logic is tightly coupled to how it's being called while the abstraction provided by the interface implied some level of decoupling, which was just confusing.
If the logic is co coupled to how it's called anyway, then indeed it's better to get rid of the indirection and move the logic into the caller itself, which is what you've done. I think it simplified things. 
:+1:
